channel.title: History on Mark Knopfler
channel.description: Recent content in History on Mark Knopfler

item.title: Timeline
item.description: 1949 Mark is born in Glasgow, to an English mother and Hungarian émigré father. 1955 At six, he hears Lonnie Donegan, and the music bug bites him hard. 1956 Mark and family move to his mother’s home town, Newcastle-upon-Tyne. 1960 Further musical inspiration comes from his uncle Kingsley, who plays harmonica and boogie-woogie piano, and Hank Marvin, when Mark hears the Shadows’ “Apache.” 1962-63 Entering his teens, he stops to gape in a Newcastle guitar shop window at a red Fender Stratocaster.
